snippet: Jimmy K. Meng, a former Queens Assemblyman, admitted Wednesday he had solicited $80,000 from a friend facing criminal charges, claiming he could use it to bribe prosecutors.
abstract: Jimmy K Meng, former New York State Assemblyman from Queens, pleads guilty to one count of wire fraud; Meng is the latest elected New York official to run afoul of the law; some 28 state-level elected officials or former officials have been caught up in scandals or criminal investigations in the last six years.
lead_paragraph: Jimmy K. Meng, a former Queens Assemblyman, admitted Wednesday he had solicited $80,000 from a friend facing criminal charges, claiming he could use it to bribe prosecutors.

headline.seo: Ex-Assemblyman Meng Pleads Guilty in Bribe Case
headline.main: Ex-Legislator From Queens Pleads Guilty in Bribe Case
headline.print_headline: Ex-Legislator From Queens Pleads Guilty in Bribe Case
